meanings.definition: To be lazy or negligent in one's work or duties.
meanings.sent1: She was slacking off during the project, not putting in any effort.
meanings.sent2: He always ends up slacking when it comes to doing his homework.
meanings.sent3: The cat was slacking on its duty as a mouse catcher, taking a nap instead.
meanings.sent4: The engine was slacking in performance, causing the car to move slowly.
meanings.sent5: The student's grades were slacking due to lack of studying.

meanings.definition: The act of avoiding work or responsibilities.
meanings.sent1: Her constant slacking at the office was noticed by the boss.
meanings.sent2: Slacking off will only lead to more work piling up later on.
meanings.sent3: The slacking of the employee resulted in a backlog of tasks.
meanings.sent4: The team suffered due to the slacking of one member who didn't contribute.
meanings.sent5: The manager addressed the issue of slacking during the team meeting.

meanings.definition: A period of time spent not working or being productive.
meanings.sent1: Taking a short slacking break can help refresh the mind for better focus.
meanings.sent2: The slacking during the weekend was a welcome change after a busy week.
meanings.sent3: The slacking in the park under the shade of a tree was quite relaxing.
meanings.sent4: The slacking by the beach was a peaceful escape from the daily routine.
meanings.sent5: The slacking in the hammock was a blissful moment of rest.
